content.question: The velocity of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, e raised to the t minus 1 power, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the total distance traveled by the particle over the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, is less than or equal to 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of, v of 0, end absolute vale, times 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 1, of, v of t, d t, minus, the integral from, 1 to 3, of, v of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3, of, v of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of the integral from, 0 to 1, of, v of t, d t, plus, the integral from, 1 to 3, of, v of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>−</mo><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo>+</mo><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the integral from, 0 to 1, of, v of t, d t, plus, the integral from, 1 to 3, of, v of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>−</mo><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo>+</mo><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
